channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-20571] JMXJsonServlet generates invalid JSON if it has NaN in metrics
item.description:
/jmx servlet responses invalid JSON, if some metrics are NaN:

    "l1CacheHitCount" : 0,
    "l1CacheMissCount" : 0,
    "l1CacheHitRatio" : NaN,
    "l1CacheMissRatio" : NaN,
    "l2CacheHitCount" : 0,
    "l2CacheMissCount" : 0,
    "l2CacheHitRatio" : 0.0,
    "l2CacheMissRatio" : 0.0,

NaN is an invalid character sequence in JSON. We should not response NaN in metrics.
item.summary: JMXJsonServlet generates invalid JSON if it has NaN in metrics

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

+1 from me. Thanks for fixing this. I noticed it but hacked my json parse to deal with occasional NaN rather than do the real fix as you have. I'll not commit yet. tedyu@apache.org has a comment up on RB. Perhaps you want to address.

Does this affect other versions than just 2.0.x?

I uploaded a more general solution, where JSONBean class serializes special floating point values as "NaN", "Infinity" or "-Infinity".

apurtell yes, it also affects branch-1, patch is there.

Ok
Committing. Will make sure those precommit failures aren't actually related
Pushed to branch-1.3 and up, including branch-2.0 per stack's +1
Thanks apurtell and meszibalu for fixing issue I was too lazy to figure.

SUCCESS: Integrated in Jenkins build HBase-1.3-IT #407 (See https://builds.apache.org/job/HBase-1.3-IT/407/)
HBASE-20571 JMXJsonServlet generates invalid JSON if it has NaN in (apurtell: rev 2ea2eedda86eea9db5797cf2444f56ddb5e8b168)
